com.joffrey_bion.compression.move_to_front

Class MoveToFront

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joffrey_bion.compression.move_to_front.MoveToFront

  • public class MoveToFront
extends Object
    A class used to apply the move-to-front transform to characters in a stream, or to a block of characters (given as a String).

    Important: All characters in the same message have to be encoded (or decoded) by the same MoveToFront object. However, the list has to be reinitialized (or a new object created) between encoding and decoding processes.

    Characters can be encoded using the original transform or the adapted transform.

    • The original transform represents a character by its index in the list of recent used symbols, as an int. This transform is applied via the methods rawTransform(char) and rawReverse(int). The drawback of this direct encoding is that an int binary representation is twice as big as a char.
    • The adapted transform gives a char representation of the index, so that it can actually be used for compression, without making the file bigger. This adapted transform is applied via the methods encode(char) and decode(char), and is also used in the block transforming methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoveToFront()
      Creates a new MoveToFront encoder or decoder.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      • rawTransform

        public int rawTransform(char c)
        Transforms a single character.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to transform via MTF.
        Returns:
        The index of c in the MTF list.
        See Also:
        encode(char)

      • rawReverse

        public char rawReverse(int index)
        Retrieves a single character.
        Parameters:
        index - An index in the MTF list.
        Returns:
        The character located at the given index in the MTF list.
        See Also:
        decode(char)

      • encode

        public char encode(char c)
        Transforms a single character.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to transform via MTF.
        Returns:
        A character representation of the index of c in the MTF list.
        See Also:
        rawTransform(char)

      • decode

        public char decode(char i)
        Retrieves the character corresponding to the given index (transformed character).
        Parameters:
        i - The character representation of an index in the MTF list.
        Returns:
        The character located at the given index in the MTF list.
        See Also:
        rawReverse(int)

      • encodeBlock

        public String encodeBlock(String block)
        Transforms a block of characters.
        Parameters:
        block - The block to transform via MTF.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the indexes of the block's characters in the MTF list, as if all characters were transformed one by one via encode(char).
        See Also:
        encode(char)

      • decodeBlock

        public String decodeBlock(String block)
        Retrieves the block corresponding to the given transformed block.
        Parameters:
        block - A String whose characters are the representations of indexes in the MTF list.
        Returns:
        The reversed blocked as if all characters were reversed via decode(char).
        See Also:
        decode(char)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the list of characters to the lexicographical order. This method has to be called between 2 encoding or decoding operations.
